DB5.description:
Description: The 1964 Aston Martin DB5 is an iconic British grand tourer, renowned for its elegant design and powerful performance. The DB5 gained legendary status as James Bond's car in the 1964 film Goldfinger, further cementing its place in automotive history.

Transmission: Five-speed/Manual

Continental GT.description:
Description: The 2003 Bentley Continental GT is a luxurious grand tourer that marked a significant shift for Bentley. It was the first model introduced after Bentley's acquisition by Volkswagen, featuring a blend of traditional craftsmanship and modern technology. This model was praised for its powerful performance, elegant design, and high-quality interior.

E-Type.description:
Description: The 1961 Jaguar E-Type, also known as the Jaguar XK-E in North America, is a legendary British sports car that was produced from 1961 to 1974. It was renowned for its stunning design, advanced technology, and impressive performance. The E-Type quickly became an icon in the automotive world and remains highly sought after by collectors today.

XJ220.description:
Description:The 1992 Jaguar XJ220 is a legendary supercar produced by Jaguar in collaboration with Tom Walkinshaw Racing.The XJ220 was initially conceived as a V12-engined, four-wheel-drive concept but was later produced with a V6 engine and rear-wheel drive due to engineering and emissions requirements1. It remains an iconic piece of automotive history.

Transmission: Five-Speed Manual

Horsepower: 542
Torque(lb/ft): 475
Top Speed(mph): 212
Dimensions(in): 194.1 x 79.1 x 45.3

XK120.description:

XKSS.description:
Description: The 1957 Jaguar XKSS is a rare and iconic sports car with a fascinating history. Only 16 units were originally built in 19571. A factory fire destroyed nine unfinished cars, making the XKSS even rarer. In 2016, Jaguar announced a continuation series to complete the original planned production run, hand-building nine new XKSS models to the exact original specification.
Engine: Inline 6
Transmission: 4-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 5.2
Horsepower: 250
Torque(lb/ft): 260
Top Speed(mph): 149
Dimensions(in): 157.1 x 65.4 x 44.1
Curb Weight(lb): 2,030
Fuel Economy(MPG): Not Available

Discovery Sport.description:
Description:The curb significance of a 2017 Land Rover Discovery Sport refers to its ability to handle uneven terrain and obstacles like curbs with ease due to its high ground clearance, capable all-wheel drive system, and advanced terrain response settings, making it suitable for light off-roading situations while still maintaining a comfortable on-road driving experience; essentially, it can navigate curbs and rough surfaces better than many standard SUVs in its class.
Engine: Turbocharged 2.0L Inline-4
Transmission: 9-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 7.8
Horsepower: 240
Torque(lb/ft): 250
Top Speed(mph): 124
Dimensions(in): 181 x 75 x 68
Curb Weight(lb): 3,854
Fuel Economy(MPG): 22

E30 M3.description:

Isetta 300.description:
Description: The BMW Isetta 300 was a continuation of the Isetta 250, manufactured from 1957 to 1962. The updated model was due to a German government change of regulation that made producing a 250cc opposed to a 300 cc not worth it because it no longer allowed Class IV to operate anything larger than a small motorcycle. Due to a tax loophole in 1961, some Isetta's only came with three wheels.
Engine: BMW 4-Stroke
Transmission: 4-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): NA
Horsepower: 13
Torque(lb/ft): 13.6
Top Speed(mph): 53
Dimensions(in): 88.6 x 52.8 x 53
Curb Weight(lb): 778

M1.description:

300SL.description:

Breath-taking engine output of 215 hp (158 kW) provided a top speed of 250 km/h, depending on final drive ratio. That made the 300 SL the fastest production car of its day.

The combination of its extreme rarity, direct lineage to a championship-winning race car, and untouched condition makes it a coveted collector's item.

R107.description:

Initially introduced as a successor to the W113 “Pagoda” SL, the R107 SL brought a modernized design and advanced features to the luxury convertible segment.

W124.description:
Description: The W124 was considered the last true Mercedes, combining reliability with modernity, safety, and fuel efficiency. Its aerodynamics were impressive for its time, even rivaling modern cars. The W124 lineup offered a model for everyone, including sedans, wagons, and coupes, accommodating various interests and needs.

356 C.description:

918 Spyder.description:

930 Turbo.description:

The twin-turbocharged 959 was considered an astonishing achievement back in 1986, regarded as the most technologically advanced road-going sportscar ever created.

993.description:

The Turbo's bodywork differs from the Carrera by widened rear wheel arches (about 6 cm), redesigned front and rear bumper moldings, and a fixed 'whale tail' rear wing housing the intercoolers.

GT1.description:

In 1998, Porsche launches an overhauled version of the 911 GT1, featuring the first carbon fibre chassis to be used by Porsche. The vehicle shown is used by Team Zakspeed in the FIA GT World Championship in 1998.

Beetle.description:

Born in the tumultuous times of pre-war Germany and refined in the post-war period, the Beetle was the brainchild of Ferdinand Porsche, under the directive of Adolf Hitler to create a 'people's car' (Volkswagen).

4C.description:

Fans of seductive styling and elemental motoring will find much to enjoy here.

308 GTB.description:
Description: The 308 GTB made its debut at the Paris and London shows in 1975. Built to a Pininfarina design by Scaglietti, it retained the 308 GT4′s V8, albeit with dry sump lubrication. The latter made for lower engine mounting and better cooling thanks to the fact that more oil was present.

Enzo.description:
Description: It might be hard to believe, but the Enzo was introduced over two decades ago. While the F40 and F50 were produced to honor anniversaries, the Enzo was introduced to celebrate the success of Ferrari's Formula 1 team. It is fitting that the car designed to honor Enzo Ferrari's passion is named after him.

Transmission: 6-Speed Maumatic

Torque(lb/ft): 485

F40.description:
Description: As the successor to the 288 GTO (also engineered by Materazzi), it was designed to celebrate Ferrari's 40th anniversary and was the last Ferrari automobile personally approved by Enzo Ferrari. At the time it was Ferrari's fastest, most powerful, and most expensive car for sale.
Engine: Twin Turbocharged 2.9L V8
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 3.8
Horsepower: 471
Torque(lb/ft): 426
Top Speed(mph): 201
Dimensions(in): 171.5 x 77.6 x 46.3
Curb Weight(lb): 2,765
Fuel Economy(MPG): 19

F50.description:
Description: The F50s design draws heavily from Ferrari's formula team. It also marked the 50th year of Ferrari's operations.
Engine: 4.7L V12
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 3.8
Horsepower: 512
Torque(lb/ft): 347
Top Speed(mph): 202
Dimensions(in): 176.4 x 78.2 x 44.1
Curb Weight(lb): 3,080
Fuel Economy(MPG): 8

GTO.description:
Description: The 250 GTO was the ultimate expression of the Ferrari 250 GT car. It was equally at home on the road or track – perhaps the last dual purpose road/race car produced – and has achieved legendary status amongst aficionados of the marque.
Engine: 3.0L V12
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 6.1
Horsepower: 300
Torque(lb/ft): 217
Top Speed(mph): 174
Dimensions(in): 170.3 x 63 x 47.6
Curb Weight(lb): 1,940
Fuel Economy(MPG): 12

La Ferarri.description:
Description: The LaFerrari delivered many firsts for a Ferrari road cars but perhaps the most notable are its debuting of the HY-KERS hybrid technology, which both maximises performance and reduces fuel consumption. It also came with active aerodynamics.
Engine: 6.3L V12 paired with a 150hp electric motor
Transmission: 7-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 2.4
Horsepower: 950
Torque(lb/ft): 516
Top Speed(mph): 220
Dimensions(in): 185.1 x 78.4 x 43.9
Curb Weight(lb): 3,009
Fuel Economy(MPG): 16.7

Testarossa.description:
Description: While it was more civilized and refined than the 512 BB, the wild looks and performance made the Testarossa a proper supercar. Testarossa sales success for Ferrari and a pop-culture icon that inspired countless copycats throughout the 80s and 90s.
Engine: 4.9L Flat-12
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 5.2
Horsepower: 380
Torque(lb/ft): 354
Top Speed(mph): 180
Dimensions(in): 176.6 x 77.8 x 44.5
Curb Weight(lb): 3,020
Fuel Economy(MPG): 18

Countach.description:
Description: The Coutach had an increase in power compared to previous Lamborghinis. It quickly became a culutural icon and continues to be one today.
Engine: 5.2L V12
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 4.8
Horsepower: 450
Torque(lb/ft): 369
Top Speed(mph): 185
Dimensions(in): 163 x 78.7 x 42.1
Curb Weight(lb): 3,280
Fuel Economy(MPG): 17.4

Gallardo.description:
Description: The Gallardo was the best selling model during its production run with over 14,000 units being sold. This gave the company financial stability and allowed Lamborghini to continue producing cars at a more comfortable rate.
Engine: 5.0L V10
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 4.2
Horsepower: 494
Torque(lb/ft): 376
Top Speed(mph): 192
Dimensions(in): 169 x 75 x 46
Curb Weight(lb): 3,153
Fuel Economy(MPG): 10

LM002.description:
Description: The 1987 Lamborghini LM002 is special because it's a rare, luxury off-road vehicle with a powerful V12 engine, designed for extreme terrain, featuring a luxurious interior, and is often nicknamed the 'Rambo Lambo' due to its aggressive looks and association with Sylvester Stallone; essentially a high-performance SUV with military-grade capabilities, making it a unique blend of luxury and ruggedness in the automotive world.
Engine: 5.2L V12
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 7.7
Horsepower: 444
Torque(lb/ft): 368
Top Speed(mph): 118
Dimensions(in): 192.2 x 78.7 x 72.8
Curb Weight(lb): 6,780
Fuel Economy(MPG): 8

Miura.description:
Description: The 1966 Lamborghini Miura is considered special because it was the first production car to feature a mid-mounted engine layout, essentially establishing the 'supercar' category as we know it today, and upon its release, it was also the fastest production car in the world, setting a new standard for high-performance sports cars with its sleek design and powerful V12 engine.
Engine: 3.9L V12
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 6.3
Horsepower: 350
Torque(lb/ft): 278
Top Speed(mph): 163
Dimensions(in): 171.1 x 69.3 x 41.5
Curb Weight(lb): 2,848
Fuel Economy(MPG): 12.7

Rally 037.description:
Description: The Lancia Rally 037 was the last rear-wheel drive car in rally history to win a world title, in an era when all-wheel drive was now dominant.
Engine: Supercharged 2.0L Inline-4
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 7.0
Horsepower: 205
Torque(lb/ft): 167
Top Speed(mph): 137
Dimensions(in): 154.1 x 72.8 x 49
Curb Weight(lb): 2,579
Fuel Economy(MPG): 19.9

Utopia.description:
Description: The Pagani Utopia is considered special due to its combination of exquisite design, exceptional performance, a focus on lightweight engineering, and the option for a manual transmission, all while maintaining a luxurious and handcrafted feel, essentially representing the pinnacle of Pagani's design and engineering prowess with a focus on driving purity and a timeless aesthetic; it's often described as a 'dream car' due to its near-perfect balance of beauty and performance.
Engine: Twin Turbocharged 6.0L V12
Transmission: 7-Speed AMT(Automated Manual Transmission)
0-60(mph): 3.0
Horsepower: 864
Torque(lb/ft): 811
Top Speed(mph): 217
Dimensions(in): 181 x 80.2 x 46
Curb Weight(lb): 2,822
Fuel Economy(MPG): 18.7

Zonda R Evo.description:
Description: The 2011 Pagani Zonda R Evo, also known as the Zonda R Evolution, is special because it's a track-focused, extremely limited edition variant of the Zonda R with enhanced performance, featuring a more powerful engine producing around 800 horsepower, upgraded aerodynamics for increased downforce, and a lightweight construction, making it one of the most extreme and sought-after Pagani models ever produced; only a handful were built, making it incredibly rare and valuable.
Engine: 6.0L V-12
Transmission: 6-Speed Sequntial
0-60(mph): 2.7
Horsepower: 800
Torque(lb/ft): 524
Top Speed(mph): 230
Dimensions(in): 192.4 x 79.3 x 44.9
Curb Weight(lb): 2,359
Fuel Economy(MPG): 12

Integra.description:
Description: At a blaring 8400 rpm, the Acura Integra Type R's pistons are pedaling at about 80 feet per second—much higher than the commonly accepted threshold of 67 feet per second. That's close to the piston speeds in Formula 1 and Indy-car engines, which have much shorter strokes than the under-square Integra powerplant.
Engine: Turbocharged 1.5L Inline-4
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 6.6
Horsepower: 195
Torque(lb/ft): 130
Top Speed(mph): 143
Dimensions(in): 172.4 x 67.3 x 52.6
Curb Weight(lb): 2,667
Fuel Economy(MPG): 25

NSX.description:
Description: The 1990 Acura NSX was the first mass-produced car to feature an all-aluminum monocoque body, making it a pioneer in lightweight, high-strength construction, inspired by the design of the Japanese bullet train (Shinkansen).
Engine: 3.0L V6
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual/4-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 5.9
Horsepower: 270
Torque(lb/ft): 210
Top Speed(mph): 168
Dimensions(in): 173.43 x 71.26 x 46.06
Curb Weight(lb): 3,108
Fuel Economy(MPG): 22.5

240Z.description:
Description: The 240sx was America's first popular Japanese sports car. Proven to be a timeless design. Its success paved the way for subsequent iterations of the Z-car lineage, including the iconic 280Z, 300ZX, and the modern-day 370Z.
Engine: 2.4L Inline-6
Transmission: 4-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 8.7
Horsepower: 151
Torque(lb/ft): 146
Top Speed(mph): 122
Dimensions(in): 162.8 x 64.1 x 50.6
Curb Weight(lb): 2,302
Fuel Economy(MPG): 14

Civic Hatchback.description:
Description: The Civic Hatchback's suspension is designed to provide a sporty feel while also improving ride comfort. It features a combination of front MacPherson struts and rear multi-link with a rigid subframe.
Engine: Turbocharged 1.5L Inline-4
Transmission: CVT
0-60(mph): 7.5
Horsepower: 174
Torque(lb/ft): 162
Top Speed(mph): 127
Dimensions(in): 197 x 74 x 57
Curb Weight(lb): 3,117
Fuel Economy(MPG): 33

S2000.description:
Description: The Honda S2000 has perfect weight distribution.
Engine: 2.0L Inline-4
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 6.2
Horsepower: 247
Torque(lb/ft): 161
Top Speed(mph): 150
Dimensions(in): 162.2 x 68.9 x 50.6
Curb Weight(lb): 2,776
Fuel Economy(MPG): 23.7

LFA.description:
Description: Car enthusiasts generally view the Lexus LFA as a highly desirable, iconic supercar with an incredible engine sound and driving experience, despite its limited production and high price, often considering it one of the best-sounding and most special cars ever made by Lexus, even if not the fastest on paper; many say it's a car that should be driven on a racetrack to fully appreciate its capabilities and character.
Engine: 4.8L V10
Transmission: Six-Speed Automated Manual
0-60(mph): 3.6
Horsepower: 552
Torque(lb/ft): 354
Top Speed(mph): 202
Dimensions(in): 177.4 x 74.6 x 48.0
Curb Weight(lb): 3,300
Fuel Economy(MPG): 12

LS 400.description:
Description: When the LS400 was first launched, it was designed with such a focus on refinement and luxury that the development team spent years researching the perfect leather, even setting up camp in California to directly study the preferences of potential luxury car buyers in the region, essentially 'living' with their target market to understand their needs fully.
Engine: 4.0L V8
Transmission: 4-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 8.2
Horsepower: 250
Torque(lb/ft): 260
Top Speed(mph): 155
Dimensions(in): 197 x 72 x 55
Curb Weight(lb): 3,759
Fuel Economy(MPG): 15.6

RX 300.description:
Description: The RX 300 was the first luxury SUV that was based on a car, rather than a conventional body-on-frame design.
Engine: 3.0L V6
Transmission: 4-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 8.5
Horsepower: 220
Torque(lb/ft): 222
Top Speed(mph): 112
Dimensions(in): 180 x 72 x 66
Curb Weight(lb): 3,924
Fuel Economy(MPG): 20

Miata MX-5.description:
Description: One of the most striking aspects of the Miata MX-5 is its lightweight design, which contributes to its nimble handling and enhances its fuel efficiency, making it an ideal choice for driving enthusiasts looking for an engaging experience on the road.
Engine: 1.6L Inline-4
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 8.8
Horsepower: 116
Torque(lb/ft): 100
Top Speed(mph): 116
Dimensions(in): 156.3 x 65.9 x 48.6
Curb Weight(lb): 2,105
Fuel Economy(MPG): 28.06

Altima.description:
Description: The Nissan Altima hits a lot of the right buttons for value-conscious car shoppers looking for a mid-size sedan. Pitted against strong rivals like the Honda Accord and Toyota Camry, the Altima doesn't exactly stand out, but it also doesn't trip over itself while trying to keep up.
Engine: 3.5L V6
Transmission: CVT
0-60(mph): 6.2
Horsepower: 270
Torque(lb/ft): 251
Top Speed(mph): 146
Dimensions(in): 192 x 72 x 58
Curb Weight(lb):
Fuel Economy(MPG): 22.3

R32 GTR.description:
Description: The 1993 Nissan Skyline GT-R R32, often nicknamed 'Godzilla,' is famous for its incredible performance, dominating racing circuits with its twin-turbo engine and advanced all-wheel drive system, winning the Japanese Grand Touring Championship four years in a row upon its release, and being considered one of the most iconic Japanese cars ever made; it's also known for its relatively 'understated' exterior design compared to its raw power, making it a sleeper car in many eyes.
Engine: Twin Turbocharged 2.6L Inline-6
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 5.3
Horsepower: 276
Torque(lb/ft):
Top Speed(mph): 156
Dimensions(in): 178.9 x 69.1 x 52.8
Curb Weight(lb): 3,150
Fuel Economy(MPG): 14.7

R34 GTR.description:
Description: The R34, which debuted in 1999, was a significant evolution from its predecessors, combining advanced technology with unparalleled performance. The Skyline series had a storied history in Japan, with the R34 marking a pivotal moment in its development.
Engine: Twin-Turbocharged 2.6L Inline 6
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 4.2
Horsepower: 330
Torque(lb/ft): 298
Top Speed(mph): 165
Dimensions(in): 181.1 x 70.3 x 53.3
Curb Weight(lb): 3,492
Fuel Economy(MPG): 15.96

WRX.description:
Description: The 2002 Subaru WRX is significant because it marked the first time the high-performance WRX model was widely available in the United States, giving American drivers access to a rally-inspired, turbocharged car at a relatively affordable price, making it a popular choice among enthusiasts and considered a 'factory rally car for the road' due to its performance and all-wheel drive system; it's often referred to as the 'Bugeye' due to its distinctive circular headlights.
Engine: Turbocharged 2.5L Flat-4
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 5.4
Horsepower: 227
Torque(lb/ft): 217
Top Speed(mph): 145
Dimensions(in): 173 x 68 x 59
Curb Weight(lb): 3,220
Fuel Economy(MPG): 21.6

2000GT.description:
Description: The 2000GT revolutionized the automotive world's view of Japan, then viewed as a producer of imitative and stodgily practical vehicles. As a sleek, high-performance fastback coupé, it demonstrated its auto makers could produce a sports car to rival the better marques of Europe.
Engine: 2.0L Inline-6
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual/3-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 10
Horsepower: 150
Torque(lb/ft): 130
Top Speed(mph): 135
Dimensions(in): 164.4 x 63 x 45.7
Curb Weight(lb): 2,469
Fuel Economy(MPG): 32

Avalon TRD.description:
Description: The 2021 Toyota Avalon TRD was designed to be a performance sedan with a sportier feel than the standard Avalon.
Engine: 3.5L V6
Transmission: Automatic 8-Speed
0-60(mph): 5.9
Horsepower: 301
Torque(lb/ft): 267
Top Speed(mph): 130
Dimensions(in): 196 x 73 x 57
Curb Weight(lb): 3,665
Fuel Economy(MPG): 40.20

Century.description:
Description: The Toyota Century is the top level executive luxury flagship Japanese car in Japan. Mostly used by the president, diplomats, governors, and other high ranking government officials and a few wealthy private owners who are comfortable with the yearly road tax bill.
Engine: 5.0L V12
Transmission: 4-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 7.5
Horsepower: 295
Torque(lb/ft): 340
Top Speed(mph): 149
Dimensions(in): 207 x 74 x 58.1
Curb Weight(lb): 4,030
Fuel Economy(MPG): 13.98

Highlander.description:
Description: The highlander is a popular vehicle of choice due to its efficient hybrid powertrain, well-designed cabin, and strong build quality.
Engine: 3.5L V6
Transmission: 6-Speed Auto
0-60(mph): 7.6
Horsepower: 270
Torque(lb/ft): 248
Top Speed(mph): NA
Dimensions(in): 191.1 x 75.8 x 68.1
Curb Weight(lb): 4,224
Fuel Economy(MPG): 20

Prius.description:
Description: The 2004 Toyota Prius was a gas/electric hybrid sedan that was designed to be a practical, fuel-efficient, and environmentally-friendly vehicle.
Engine: 1.5L Inline-4
Transmission: CVT
0-60(mph): 9.8
Horsepower: 76
Torque(lb/ft): 82
Top Speed(mph): 105.6
Dimensions(in): 175 x 68 x 58
Curb Weight(lb): 2,890
Fuel Economy(MPG): 43.35

Supra MKIV.description:
Description: A 1993 Toyota Supra was designed as a high-performance, rear-wheel drive sports car, primarily intended to compete in the grand tourer market with its powerful engine, excellent handling, and luxurious features, aiming to rival other high-end sports cars from American and European manufacturers; essentially, its purpose was to offer a potent driving experience with a blend of speed, comfort, and style.
Engine: Turbocharged 3.0L Inline-6
Transmission: 8-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 4.6
Horsepower: 220
Torque(lb/ft): 315
Top Speed(mph): 154
Dimensions(in): 178 x 71 x 50
Curb Weight(lb): 3,415
Fuel Economy(MPG): 19

Supra MKV.description:
Description: The MKV Supra's engine is based on BMW's Z4 platform.
Engine: Turbocharged 3.0L Inline-6
Transmission: Eight-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 3.9
Horsepower: 382
Torque(lb/ft): 368
Top Speed(mph): 155
Dimensions(in): 170.8 x 72.3 x 50.4
Curb Weight(lb): 3,109
Fuel Economy(MPG): 27

Genesis.description:
Description: The 2011 Hyundai Genesis 4.6L is a large sedan that offers a luxurious driving experience at a relatively affordable price. It's designed to be a comfortable, well-engineered car that rivals high-end luxury sedans. Some say the Genesis is a good choice for those who are more concerned with the driving experience than brand prestige.
Engine: 4.6L V8
Transmission: 6-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 5.3
Horsepower: 385
Torque(lb/ft): 333
Top Speed(mph): 149
Dimensions(in): 195.9 x 74.4 x 58.3
Curb Weight(lb): 4,012
Fuel Economy(MPG): 20

P1800.description:
Description: The Volvo P1800 received prominence in the early 1960s when a white 1962 Volvo P1800 with number plate ST1 was driven by the character Simon Templar (Roger Moore) in the TV series The Saint (1962–1969). The car became intimately linked to the show and helped raise Volvo's profile at the time.
Engine: 1.8L Inline-4
Transmission: 4-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 13.2
Horsepower: 100
Torque(lb/ft): 108
Top Speed(mph): 105
Dimensions(in): 173.2 x 66 x 50.4
Curb Weight(lb): 2,590
Fuel Economy(MPG): 23.5

CTS-V.description:
Description: The 2012 Cadillac CTS-V Wagon was designed to be a high-performance, five-passenger vehicle that could handle daily tasks, road trips, and more.
Engine: 6.2L V8 with Blower
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual/6-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 3.9
Horsepower: 556
Torque(lb/ft): 551
Top Speed(mph): 185
Dimensions(in): 191 x 73 x 59
Curb Weight(lb): 4,392
Fuel Economy(MPG): 17

Camaro Z28.description:
Description: 1981 was the last year of the second generation Camaro. It included lower power specs due to stricter emission regulations.
Engine: 5.7L V8
Transmission: 3-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 8.7
Horsepower: 175
Torque(lb/ft): 275
Top Speed(mph): 120
Dimensions(in): 197.6 x 74.5 x 49.2
Curb Weight(lb): 3,374
Fuel Economy(MPG): 9.07

DMC-12.description:
Description: The DeLorean DMC-12 became and remained famous as the time-traveling car in the Back to the Future movies—but the actual automobile was infamous for years before Marty McFly stepped inside one in 1985. And, though the fiction is better remembered today, the real story of the DeLorean is just as dramatic.
Engine: 2.85L V6
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual/3-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 10.5
Horsepower: 130
Torque(lb/ft): 153
Top Speed(mph): 130
Dimensions(in): 168.1 x 72.8 x 46.1
Curb Weight(lb): 2,718
Fuel Economy(MPG): 18.86

Viper.description:
Description: The Dodge Viper (SR I) is the first-generation Viper sports car, manufactured by American automobile manufacturer Dodge. It was originally tested in January 1989 as a prototype, then later introduced in 1991 as a pace car for the Indianapolis 500, then finally going on sale in January 1992.
Engine: 8.0L V10
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 4.5
Horsepower: 400
Torque(lb/ft): 450
Top Speed(mph): 165
Dimensions(in): 175 x 76 x 44
Curb Weight(lb): 3,476
Fuel Economy(MPG): 14

F-150 Supercrew.description:
Description: The 2001 Ford F-150 SuperCab represents a popular combination of a spacious extended cab ('SuperCab') with a powerful V8 engine, marking a time when Ford was offering strong performance in a mid-size pickup truck while also providing additional passenger space compared to standard cab models; the 5.4L 'Triton' V8 engine was particularly well-regarded for its power and towing capabilities in this generation of F-150s.
Engine: 5.4L V8
Transmission: 4-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 8.7
Horsepower: 220
Torque(lb/ft): 260
Top Speed(mph): 110
Dimensions(in): 244.1 x 79.3 x 72.5
Curb Weight(lb): 4,213
Fuel Economy(MPG): 15

GT.description:
Description: The Ford GT is a masterpiece of design, blending form and function in a way that few vehicles can. Its aerodynamically optimized teardrop shape and multifunctional buttresses are aesthetically pleasing and serve a crucial role in minimizing drag and maximizing downforce.
Engine: Supercharged 5.4L V8
Transmission: 6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 3.3
Horsepower: 550
Torque(lb/ft): 500
Top Speed(mph): 205
Dimensions(in): 183 x 77 x 44
Curb Weight(lb): 3,485
Fuel Economy(MPG): 14

GT40.description:
Description: The Ford GT40 is a high-performance mid-engined racing car originally designed and built for and by the Ford Motor Company to compete in 1960s European endurance racing. Its specific impetus was to best Scuderia Ferrari, which had won the prestigious 24 Hours of Le Mans race for six years running from 1960 to 1965.
Engine: 5.0L V8
Transmission: 5-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 5.5
Horsepower: 540
Torque(lb/ft): 325
Top Speed(mph): 200
Dimensions(in): 158.6 x 70 x 40.5
Curb Weight(lb): 2,100
Fuel Economy(MPG): 11

Mustang Dark Horse.description:
Description: When properly equipped, the Dark Horse is capable of remarkable handling and impressive braking. The 500-hp V8 isn't too shabby either. Some traditionalists might scoff at the 2024 Mustang's digital interior but we think the biggest detriment to the Dark Horse is its steep asking price.
Engine: 5.0L V8
Transmission: 10-Speed Automatic/6-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 3.7
Horsepower: 500
Torque(lb/ft):
Top Speed(mph): 418
Dimensions(in): 190 x 76 x 55
Curb Weight(lb): 3,879
Fuel Economy(MPG): 17

Mustang Fastback.description:
Description: Improved suspension and handling characterised 1968 Mustangs, with the best stopping ability of any pony car to date. Cars with 390cid, 427, and 428cid used power discs; power steering was highly desirable with V8s or those with wide tires.
Engine: 5.0L V
Transmission: 4-Speed Manual Transmission
0-60(mph): 5.9
Horsepower: 325
Torque(lb/ft): 310
Top Speed(mph): 123
Dimensions(in): 183.6 x 70.9 x 51.6
Curb Weight(lb): 2,990
Fuel Economy(MPG): 12.52

CJ-7.description:
Description: The 1976 CJ-7 stretched the wheelbase by 10 inches (25 cm), and made doors and a removable hardtop common items. After remaining in production through a range of model numbers, and several corporate parents, the Jeep CJ line was officially ended after 1986.
Engine: 4.2L Inline-6
Transmission: 3-Speed Automatic/3-Speed Manual
0-60(mph): 11
Horsepower: 90
Torque(lb/ft): 192
Top Speed(mph): NA
Dimensions(in): 148 x 68.5 x 70.3
Curb Weight(lb): 2,710
Fuel Economy(MPG): 9.61

Continental.description:
Description: The 1969 Lincoln Continental was the last year of the classic Continental, and was designed to be a class act and the end of an era. The Continental was a luxury car that emphasized styling, comfort, and features over performance and handling.
Engine: 7.5L V8
Transmission: 3-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 7.4
Horsepower: 365
Torque(lb/ft): 460
Top Speed(mph): 110
Dimensions(in): 224.2 x 79.7 x 54.2
Curb Weight(lb): 5,700
Fuel Economy(MPG): 11.1

Comet.description:
Description: The 1963 Mercury Comet was significant because it was a compact car that offered luxury features at an affordable price. The Comet was marketed as a stylish and comfortable car that didn't sacrifice efficiency. This concept became more popular in the following decades.
Engine: 4.3L V8
Transmission: 3-Speed Manual/2-Speed Automatic
0-60(mph): 9.3
Horsepower: 164
Torque(lb/ft): 200
Top Speed(mph): 100
Dimensions(in): 194.5 x 70.4 x 54.5
Curb Weight(lb): 2,970
Fuel Economy(MPG): 17.0
